Class Bank

java.lang.Object
Bank
public class Bank extends Object
Simple implementation of a bank with a list of bank accounts, a current account and action the user can do

    boolean
    addBankAccount(BankAccount a)
    a method to add a new bank account to the bank - it returns true if it succeeds or false if it fails (because the bank is 'full')
    int

    change the pin by calling the new pin method

  • Method Details

    • makeBankAccount

      public BankAccount makeBankAccount(int accNumber, int accPasswd, int balance, boolean overdraft)
      a method to create new BankAccounts - this is known as a 'factory method' and is a more flexible way to do it than just using the 'new' keyword directly.

    • addBankAccount

      public boolean addBankAccount(BankAccount a)
      a method to add a new bank account to the bank - it returns true if it succeeds or false if it fails (because the bank is 'full')

    • addBankAccount

      public boolean addBankAccount(int accNumber, int accPasswd, int balance, boolean overdraft)
      a variant of addBankAccount which makes the account and adds it all in one go. Using the same name for this method is called 'method overloading' - two methods can have the same name if they take different argument combinations

    • login

      public boolean login(int newAccNumber, int newAccPasswd)
      Check whether the current saved account and password correspond to an actual bank account, and if so login to it (by setting 'account' to it) and return true. Otherwise, reset the account to null and return false

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Reset the bank to a 'logged out' state

    • loggedIn

      public boolean loggedIn()
      test whether the bank is logged in to an account or not

    • deposit

      public boolean deposit(int amount)
      try to deposit money into the account (by calling the deposit method on the BankAccount object)

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(int amount)
      try to withdraw money into the account (by calling the withdraw method on the BankAccount object)

    • getBalance

      public int getBalance()
      get the account balance (by calling the balance method on the BankAccount object)

    • changePin

      public int changePin(int number)
      change the pin by calling the new pin method
